data.title: Weekly Traffic Advisory
data.meta_description: Updates on the week's roadwork and street closures from New York City's Department of Transportation.
data.text:
Saturday August 10, 2024 to Friday August 16, 2024

This traffic alert details road construction and other events that will affect the flow of traffic this week.Check the Weekend Traffic Advisory Check the Special Traffic Advisory

Lane closings may also occur due to circumstances beyond NYC DOT's control. Schedules are subject to change due to inclement weather, security alerts and other emergencies. For up-to-the-minute information, visit 511NY, New York State's official traffic and travel information source. Visit the Office of Emergency Management and NYPD for emergency street closure updates. NYC DOT also issues supplementary Weekend Traffic Advisories and Special Alerts.Subscribe to traffic advisory email updates Visit the NYC Street Closures Map

Other state and local agencies are responsible for street construction work in New York City. Visit the Department of Design and Construction, the New York State Department of Transportation, the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey and MTA for more construction and traffic information.

Check who operates bridges and tunnels

Permits for parades, block parties, major street fairs and other public street events are not issued by NYC DOT, and are listed on the Citywide events calendar.

The City of New York's Department of Transportation issued a traffic alert for this week providing the locations of road construction and events where lane and street closings will affect the flow of traffic. Lane closings may also occur due to circumstances beyond our control. Major road, lane and street closings for the coming week are as follows:

East River Bridge Crossings

Ed Koch/Queensboro Bridge

Single-lane Queens-bound south upper roadway will be closed 24/7. Double-lane Queens-bound south upper roadway will be closed Monday to Friday from 9:30 am to 3 pm and from 8 pm to 5 am next morning, Saturday and Sunday from 5 am to 2 pm and from 8 pm to 5 am next morning. During second lane closure, one Manhattan-bound upper roadway lane will reverse to service Queens-bound traffic. Queens-bound south outer roadway will be closed Sunday to Saturday from 11 pm to 6 am next morning. These closures are necessary to facilitate replacement of upper roadway.

Brooklyn Bridge

Single-lane at a time will be closed Monday from 10 am to 3 pm in Brooklyn-bound direction and Tuesday from 12:01 am to 5 am in Manhattan-bound direction, to facilitate maintenance.

Manhattan Bridge

Single-lane at a time on the upper and lower roadways will be closed Monday to Friday from 10 pm to 5 am next morning and Thursday from 10 am to 3 pm to facilitate maintenance. At least one traffic lane in each direction will be maintained at all times.

Williamsburg Bridge

Single-lane Brooklyn-bound south outer roadway will be closed from Saturday 5 am to Monday 5 am, and Monday to Friday from 5 am to 6 pm. Single-lane Brooklyn-bound south inner roadway will be closed Monday to Friday from 10 am to 3 pm. Single-lane Manhattan-bound north outer roadway will be closed Monday to Friday from 6 pm to 5 am next morning. Single-lane Manhattan-bound north inner roadway will be closed Monday to Friday from 8 pm to 5 am next morning. These closures are necessary to facilitate Structural Strengthening and rehabilitation.

Manhattan

East 60 Street between Queensboro Exit Ramp Street and 1 Avenue

Beginning Friday August 9 through August 22, 2024, single-lane will be closed Monday to Friday from 10 pm to 5 am next morning, to facilitate painting operation.

East 61 Street between 1 Avenue and 2 Avenue

Beginning Friday, August 9 through August 16, 2024, single-lane at a time will be closed Monday to Friday from 10 pm to 5 am next morning, to facilitate painting operation.

FDR Drive at 6 Street

Single-lane in both directions will be closed Monday to Thursday from 11 pm to 5:30 am next morning through October 10, 2024, to facilitate abandon FDNY manhole and restore the roadway.

FDR Drive Southbound between Jackson Street and Cherry Street

Single-lane will be closed Monday to Thursday from 10 pm to 5:30 am next morning, Friday from 11 pm to 7 am next morning, and Sunday from 11 pm to 10 am next morning. Double-lane will be closed Tuesday to Friday from 1 am to 5 am, Saturday from 1 am to 6 am, and Sunday from 1 am to 7 am. These closures are necessary to facilitate East Side Coastal Resiliency Project and will continue through September 11, 2026.

FDR Drive between Montgomery Street and East 15 Street

Single-lane northbound and/or southbound will be closed Monday to Thursday from 10 pm to 5 am next morning, Saturday from 12:01 am to 9 am, and Sunday from 1 am to 11 am. Double-lane will be closed Tuesday to Friday from 1 am to 5 am, Saturday from 1 am to 7 am, and Sunday from 1 am to 7 am. These closures are necessary to facilitate median reconstruction and will continue through August 15, 2026.

Single-lane will be closed Monday to Friday from 10 am to 3 pm, Monday to Thursday from 10 pm to 5 am next morning, Friday from 10 pm to 7 am next morning, and Saturday from 10 am to 3 pm, through September 28, 2024, to facilitate regrade (plate cover casting).

Single-lane will be closed Monday to Friday from 10 am to 2 pm and Monday to Thursday from 11 pm to 6 am next morning, Friday from 11 pm to 2 pm next day, and Sunday from 12:01 am to 2 pm. Double-lane will be closed Monday to Friday from 12:01 am to 5 am, Saturday from 1 am to 6:30 am, and Sunday from 2 am to 9 pm. These closures are necessary to facilitate watermain repairs and will continue through August 18, 2024 .

Queensboro Bridge Exit Ramp Road between East 60 Street and East 61 Street

Roadway will be closed Monday to Friday from 1 am to 5 am through August 16, 2024, to facilitate painting operation.

Broadway Bridge over the Harlem River

Single-lane in either direction will be closed Monday to Friday from 7 am to 3 pm and double-lane will be closed from 10 am to 2 pm through August 16, 2024, to facilitate grid deck and machinery repairs. Alternating sidewalk closures will be in effect.

Madison Avenue Bridge over Harlem River

Single-lane at a time in either direction will be closed Monday to Friday from 10 am to 2 pm. Single-lane in both directions will be closed Monday to Friday from 10 pm to 6 am next morning, and Saturday from 10 pm to 7 am next morning. Bridge will be fully closed Monday to Friday from 12:01 am to 5 am. Bronx-bound will be closed Saturday from 12:01 am to 6 am and Manhattan-bound will be closed Saturday from 12:01 am to 7 am. These closures are necessary to facilitate bridge rehabilitation and will continue through August 31, 2024. Motorist may use 145 Street Bridge as an alternate route.

Manhattan-bound center lane and bike lane will be closed Tuesday from 10 pm to5 am next morning to facilitate asphalt work.

Single-lane southbound will be closed through September 9, 2024, to facilitate bridge replacement over the Metro-North Railroad. Two travel lanes southbound and three travel lanes northbound will be maintained at all times.

Traffic lane will be closed and the parking lane, along the west side, will be used as through traffic lane, through August 16, 2024 from 10 pm to 5 am next morning to facilitate rehabilitation of the retaining wall.

Trucks and buses are advised to use the exit ramp towards Edgewater Road/Hunts Point Market and follow the detour signs and use the Leggett Avenue entrance ramp to westbound Bruckner Expressway. Cars are advised to use the temporary exit ramp towards Whitlock Avenue and follow the detour signs to westbound Bruckner Expressway.

Northbound lanes will be closed starting Tuesday, August 13 through September 13, 2024 from 7 am to 3:30 pm and 9 pm to 5:30 am next morning to facilitate structural steel repairs and utility work. Two lanes of traffic in each direction will be maintained on the southbound lanes.

Hutchinson River Parkway Bridge over the Hutchinson River

Northbound lanes will be intermittently closed starting Friday, August 9 through Friday September 6, 2024, Monday to Friday from 12 am to 5 am, to facilitate removal and refurbishing of the live load assemblies. Motorists are advised to use the Shore Road Bridge as an alternate route.

Single-lane in both directions, will be closed Monday to Friday from 10 pm to 5 am next morning and double-lane in both directions, will be closed from 12:01 am to 4 am through August 30, 2024, to facilitate painting on the Westchester Avenue Bridge. One lane in each direction will be maintained.

Full closure may occur Monday to Friday between 12 am and 5 am for demolition and erection of the superstructure.

Additional lane will be closed Monday to Friday from 11 pm to 5 am, Saturday and Sunday from 1 am to 8 am, and Sunday night from 10 pm to 5 am next morning through March 3, 2025 to facilitate East 138 Street Bridge replacement. Southbound exit ramp to 138 Street bridge will be closed Monday to Friday from 11 pm to 5 am, Friday from 11 pm to 6 am next morning, Saturday from 11 pm to 9 am next morning, and Sunday from 11 pm to 5 am next morning to facilitate water main connections.

Single-lane northbound will be closed Monday to Friday from 7 am to 9 am. Single-lane in both directions will be closed Monday to Friday from 9 am to 1 pm and 10 pm to 7 am next morning. These closures are necessary to facilitate maintenance and will continue through August 16, 2024. One lane of traffic will be maintained at all times.

One traffic lane in each direction will be maintained at all times.

Single-lane in either direction will be closed Monday to Friday from 11 pm to 5 am next morning. Double-lane in either direction will be closed Monday to Friday from 1 am to 5 am. Single-lane eastbound will be closed and bridge will be fully closed intermittently for 15 minutes at a time Monday to Friday from 10 pm to 5 am next morning through August 16, 2024, to facilitate maintenance and repairs.

Bridge will be intermittently closed Monday to Friday from 11 pm to 5 am next morning through August 30, 2024, to facilitate urgent repairs. Motorists are advised to use either Union Street Bridge of the Ninth Street Bridge as an alternate route.
